image.altText: A woman in glasses looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: The financial regulator has taken action against a clothing retailer over concerns the store disputes about exposing vulnerable Aboriginal customers to financial risk.

title.children: ASIC orders NT clothing store to stop letting customers pay through Centrelink deductions

image.altText: A bushmaster vehicle with missile launches attached to the top.

props.synopsis: The Albanese government has approved a tender process that will pit the StrikeMaster mobile missile launcher against the American-made High Mobility Artillery Rocket System (HIMARS), currently being used by Ukrainian forces.

title.children: Bushmaster missile launchers with a range of 250 kilometres could soon be in place across the Top End

image.altText: A dark-haired woman in a dimly lit room.

props.synopsis: A federal Labor MP has flagged that the Commonwealth could take control of an Aboriginal art gallery project in Alice Springs and described the Northern Territory government's plan to downsize the building "offensive".

title.children: 'Size matters': MP calls for federal government to step in as Indigenous art gallery saga continues

image.altText: NT Police Commissioner Michael Murphy standing at a lectern and looking up.

props.synopsis: NT Police Commissioner Michael Murphy flies into the remote community of Milikapiti on Melville Island after three officers were attacked during an arrest, leaving one unconscious.

title.children: NT police commissioner flies into remote community after officers attacked

image.altText: Tjulapi Alison Carroll holding a microphone while sitting in a row of people

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Indigenous doctors have converged from across the globe to share their tips for good health.

title.children: Indigenous doctors from across the globe point to the benefits of first languages in health

image.altText: A smiling, dark-haired woman behind the bar in a country pub.

props.synopsis: Some publicans in NSW are ready to lose revenue in order to prioritise social connections. Should they be entitled to tax breaks for refusing to allow the destructive force in their venues?

title.children: These country pubs are surviving without poker-machine profits, but it's a battle against the odds

image.altText: Zhalin Cecil works with young boys at risk of perpetrating violence.

props.synopsis: Experts say comprehensive one-on-one early intervention programs are having positive outcomes for young males at risk of becoming adults perpetrators of family violence.

title.children: 'I became the bully of bullies': Violence in childhood can lead boys to become violent men

image.altText: Pete Hegseth is surrounded by reporters holding microphones and phones.

props.synopsis: The mother of Donald Trump's defence secretary nominee Pete Hegseth has come to the defence of her son after it was revealed she called him a serial abuser of women in a 2018 email.

title.children: 'I wrote that in haste': Mother of Trump's Pentagon pick apologises for email berating her son

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Redflow CEO Tim Harris.

props.synopsis: Redflow had political backing and a soaring ambition to sell energy storage to the world, but its $10,000 batteries regularly failed within months of installation leaving customers out of pocket.

title.children: 'Terrifying' Chinese hacking campaign sees large numbers of Americans' data stolen, US officials say

image.altText: A woman holds her phone in her hand, she is sat in front of several small us flags

props.synopsis: A large number of Americans' data has been stolen in a telecoms attack allegedly carried out by a Chinese hacking group dubbed "Salt Typhoon," and according to one senator, the extent and depth of the hack is "absolutely mind-boggling".

title.children: Large number of Americans' metadata stolen by Chinese hacking group Salt Typhoon, US officials say

image.altText: A man wearing dark glasses walking outdoors with his head bowed.

props.synopsis: The former teacher was found guilty of unlawful sexual activity with a girl aged between 10 and 17, which related to his time as a teacher in the 1980s.

title.children: Chris Dawson launches appeal over unlawful sexual activity with a student conviction

image.altText: A CCTV image of a man holding up a gun on the footpath in Manhattan, wearing a hoodie.

props.synopsis: Brian Thompson, the chief executive of UnitedHealthcare, was on his way to a corporate meeting when he was attacked.

title.children: Manhunt underway in New York after CEO of largest US health insurer shot dead

image.altText: A French man with glasses and gray hair sits in parliament.

props.synopsis: The vote has ousted Prime Minister Michel Barnier and his government, meaning President Emmanuel Macron will have to pick a viable successor with over two years of his presidential term left.

title.children: French government toppled by no-confidence motion in blow to President Emmanuel Macron

image.altText: An older man wearing a suit gives a press conference on a humid, cloudy day

props.synopsis: The parliamentary committee looking at the development proposal has voted to make the referral in its report which will be released on Friday.

title.children: Premier says building new houses in Sydney 'almost impossible' after corruption watchdog referral

image.altText: A small black ball on a beach

props.synopsis: A small number of balls appeared on the eastern end of Silver Beach in Kurnell on Thursday morning, with the Environmental Protection Authority investigating and Sutherland Shire Council cleaning up the affected area.

title.children: Mysterious balls wash up on Sydney beach as council begins clean-up

image.altText: ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: Bitcoin has pushed through the $US100,000 barrier for the first time, while the Australian currency languishes near seven-month lows and the ASX ekes out modest gains. Follow live.

title.children: ASX edges higher as Aussie dollar remains near seven-months lows and Bitcoin passes $US100,000

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Sense of 'euphoria' and 'schadenfreude' from the Bitcoin community
Bitcoin cracks $US100,000 as Donald Trump announces a pro-cypto regulator pick

image.altText: Dozens of people hold fake candles while holding signs and chanting at night

props.synopsis: A day after South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol tried to enforce martial law, MPs convene to consider both an impeachment motion and a complaint of "insurrection" against him.

title.children: South Korean ruling party demands president leave their ranks despite seeking to block impeachment motion

image.altText: Composite picture of Angus Taylor, Michele Bullock and Jim Chalmers

props.synopsis: Australia's latest national accounts show why we probably would have had to be in recession to have seen an interest rate cut this year.

title.children: What spending would you cut in a 'sad economy without much hope'?

image.altText: Dash smiles in a crowd at a music festival, the stage behind her.

props.synopsis: Young Australians are taking the opioid reversal drug naloxone with them on nights out. We've unpacked what it is and how it works, and busted some myths along the way.

title.children: 'Everyone was freaking out, screaming': Naloxone nasal spray may save lives

image.altText: Four Albatross birds standing around with a female named Wisdom looking at her egg

props.synopsis: Wisdom the Laysan albatross lays another egg this year at the Midway Atoll National Wildlife Refuge in Hawaii with a new mating partner.

title.children: World's oldest known wild bird, an albatross named Wisdom, lays egg at 74

image.altText: A close-up of hand scrolling through the news on a phone

props.synopsis: A new report by a UK research team finds adults who are more gullible struggle to tell the difference between real and fake news.

title.children: Mistrustful adults could be more vulnerable to conspiracy theories and bad at spotting fake news, report finds

image.altText: With red running track visible in background, a child sits with legs crossed and hands propping up bowed head.

props.synopsis: State and territory governments are under pressure to step in and fund compensation for victims of child sexual abuse as institutions refuse to join the national scheme.

title.children: Deal to compensate child abuse victims of sporting groups failed after just one jurisdiction held out

image.altText: A court sketch of a woman with dark skin in a suit wearing handcuffs.

props.synopsis: Australian woman Donna Nelson has been found guilty of trafficking drugs into Japan. Here is how the two-year saga unfolded and what happens next.

title.children: Japanese court finds Donna Nelson guilty, but also a victim

image.altText: A series of white pads stitched with colourful patterns.

props.synopsis: A controversy over sanitary pads in China has sparked widespread outrage on social media and ignited a broader debate on gender inequality.

title.children: Sanitary pad sizes in China ignite debate about women's rights

image.altText: A teenage girl carving along a river on a waterski.

props.synopsis: Eira Dalzell has been selected to represent Australia at the World Disabled Water Ski Championships three years after losing some of her fingers in a boating accident.

title.children: Teenage waterskier to represent Australia three years after serious boating accident

image.altText: Jamie stands next to his car

props.synopsis: Over a 10-year period, mental health claims by Australian workers aged between 30 and 40 have increased by more than 730 per cent, new data has revealed.

title.children: 'The worst feeling in your life': Workers lodging mental health claims in record numbers

image.altText: 80-year-old Aboriginal women sits in the desert playing guitar, flanked by a young boy

props.synopsis: The debut album from Kankawa Nagarra — an80-year-old Walmatjarri elder, teacher, and blues artist from remote WA — has won this year's coveted Australian Music Prize.

title.children: 80-year-old blues woman Kankawa Nagarra wins $50,000 music prize over Nick Cave, Amyl & the Sniffers

image.altText: Mike Baird speaking at a media conference at Adelaide Oval.

props.synopsis: Cricket Australia defends its position on refusing to play Afghanistan in a bilateral series after outgoing ICC chair Greg Barclay offers a parting shot at the organisation.

title.children: Cricket Australia boss 'proud' of Afghanistan stance after ICC criticism

image.altText: A toddler walks on tiles, holding an adult's hand

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Indigenous doctors have converged from across the globe to share their tips for good health.

title.children: Narni's dad says a healthy life depends on her Kaurna language

image.altText: retired lifeguard Sonny Tisdell staring out at the beach in Sawtell.

props.synopsis: Lifeguards at a NSW tourist hotspot say beach safety is at breaking point with only six full-time staff available to patrol more than 60 kilometres of coastline.

title.children: 'You'd have to be superhuman': Lifesavers working 30 days straight take court action

image.altText: Generic TV still of 2 anonymous students writing at school desk at unidentified Qld primary school.

props.synopsis: Girls have fallen behind boys in both maths and science subjects, making Australia's education gender gap the worst in the world, the latest results from a long-running international test show.

title.children: 'Interesting and disappointing': Gap between girls and boys in STEM subjects growing, report shows

image.altText: Nika Gvaramia wearing a dark jacket facing a person wearing a black face covering and hat

props.synopsis: Vision released by the Coalition for Change party shows Nika Gvaramia being carried by the arms and legs by several men and thrown into a car.

title.children: Georgian opposition says leader was knocked unconscious and detained in protests

image.altText: Two images, side by side, of a young child sitting on a man's lap at a work desk with architectural drawings on it.

props.synopsis: When Jason di Rosso started making video diaries to process the news his father was dying, he didn't plan on "baring [himself] to the public", but the result is the remarkably intimate film The Hidden Spring.

title.children: After decades of being an ABC film critic, Jason di Rosso's first feature forces him to be vulnerable

image.altText: Two small boats with divers abroad approach a large underwater shipwreck

props.synopsis: It's two months since the Royal New Zealand Navy vessel Manawanui ran aground and sank off the coast of Samoa — and locals say they can still "smell the fuel".

title.children: 'We're being ignored': Samoan village threatens to sue over NZ Navy ship sinking
